moves.37. Kf3 Kf8 38. Ke4 Ke7 39. Rf2:
Here we played it out...But moves 39 are wrong I believe.
White developed a passer on the c-file and h-files but they were both guarded.
We exchange rooks somewhere.
And I had a pawn dual Pawn-e5 & Pawn-f5 that I kept intact and didn't dare move them. 
I won his Pawn-f4 somehow.

I offered a draw but white refused. And we played 'til White and I calculated he couldn't promote his passers on c7 and h4/h5 not sure which square it was on.
opposite colored bishops. 
The pawn dual acted as buffer and prevented White from infiltrating. To me it reduced a lot of calculating.
